results.title: Angel
results.creator_credit: Dennis K. Smith, Open Channel Productions and Sharyn Prentice
results.brief_description: You may not know the name Deborah Halpern, but you will certainly recognise her ceramic sculpture with its unique tiling located out the front of the National Gallery of Victoria. Hers is the story of a young ceramic sculptor with no formal training whose public profile has proliferated as the result of an unexpected major commission from one of Australia’s most prestigious art galleries. Deborah Haplpern’s art is inspired by Niki de Phalle, the ‘Art Brut’ movement and the ‘Outsider’ artists of Europe who live and work outside the mainstream gallery system. In this documentary Deborah talks intimately about the influence of these artists on her work and life. It outlines the structure of her sculpture, Angel, as well as the artistic and intellectual processes and motivation behind her work. This is a story of achievement. It is a passionate account of a two year project, the journey of a young artist and her triumphant arrival into the public art forum.

results.title: Andy Warhol and His Work
results.brief_description: This film is a fascinating insight into the man and his work as seen through his own eyes and those of his friends. As the sixties progressed Warhol became more and more involved in film making. A number of his films are classic examples of underground movie making and are valid reflections of the more extreme ends of life in late-sixties America.

results.title: Andy and the lion
results.brief_description: Story film for children. Uses the pictures and text of James Daugherty’s fantasy, based on the Androcles legend, to tell about an American boy who becomes a local hero when his kindness to an escaped lion is repaid with the lion’s friendship. No other credits available.

results.title: And their ghosts may be heard
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Caroline Jones and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In 1893 a boat load of Australian bush workers and tradesmen sailed halfway around the world to Paraguay to establish a New Australia colony in which the old Australian principles of equality and mateship would at last be realised. The film follows the footsteps of those pioneers from a strike-torn sheep country into the heart of Paraguay, landlocked into the heart of South America, where the survivors of the great experiment still live today, dreaming in exile of the gum trees in a far-off land their ancestors chose to leave but could never forget. Presented by Caroline Jones and sourced from the book by Gavin Souter “A Peculiar people: the Australians in Paraguay”. English/Spanish language.

results.title: And spare the child
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Raises the problem of when and how to discipline children. Every culture has certain standards or values, and children absorb attitudes and values from the family. Discusses the role that discipline has to play in this process and how this discipline should change as the child grows and develops.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: And so ends
results.creator_credit: Dick Young and Dick Young Productions
results.brief_description: Uses the recollection of octogenarian Robert Cushman Murphy to provide a historical view of whaling and to present a plea for the preservation of the whale. The more recent footage shows the sophistication of modern whaling techniques and notes the years 1960-1970 represented the greatest decade of over whaling in terms of numbers killed. Narrated by Jack Palance. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: And he will rise again
results.brief_description: Easter in the modern world. The meaning of Easter is the manifold sacrifice of God and Man in the person of Jesus, atoning for the sins of mankind. Unfortunately this meaning escapes many younger Australians. Both the passion of Christ and the meaning of Easter contrast the nonchalant reality of the young people, who drift throught the Easter weekend without a thought for its ‘sacred’ significance and its application to their relatively empty lives. Written by Peter Tammer, camera by Tom Cowan and organ by Harold Fabrikant.

results.title: Anatomy of a Businessman
results.brief_description: Lunch break at Ibis Traders. Midcalf dozes uneasily inside his locked office. Tilling, suspecting that Midcalf has stolen his jar of sweet onions, seeks a confrontation. A great deal can be learnt about an animal’s habits by examining the contents of its stomach.

results.title: Analytical filtration
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional films produced to assist science teachers to demonstrate laboratory techniques to large groups of students. The film covers, in complete detail, the various operations involved in the simple technique of analytical filtration.
